Jinnō Shōtōki, p. 239. == Events of the Tokuji era == * 10 September 1308 (Tokuji 3, 8th month): In the 8th year of Go-Nijo's reign, the emperor died at age 24;Titsingh,p. 278; Imperial Household Agency (Kunaichō), 後二条天皇 (94); retrieved 2012-6-29. and the throne passed to his cousin, who would come to be known as Emperor Hanazono.Titsingh,p. 278; Varley, p. 44; a distinct act of senso is unrecognized prior to Emperor Tenji; and all sovereigns except Jitō, Yōzei, Go-Toba, and Fushimi have senso and sokui in the same year until the reign of Emperor Go-Murakami. Compare Kunaichō, Ceremony of Accession (Sokui- no-Rei); retrieved 2012-6-29. * 1308 (Tokuji 3, 10th month): The nengō was changed to Enkyō to mark the start of the reign of Emperor Hanazono.Varley, p. 240. ==Related pages == * Kamakura period == References == == Other websites == * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" Tokuji 1st 2nd 3rd 1306 1307 1308 Preceded by: Kagen Era or nengō: Tokuji Succeeded by: Enkyō Category:Japanese eras Category:1306 Category:1307 Category:1308 Category:1300s in Japan
